OK, Gang. Last week of the regular season. Your picks for 1/01/06.
 
 BTW, Now would be a good time to start your playoff and Super Bowl picks.
Buffalo's performance was mediocre at best. Their one redeeming quality were Special Teams. They're on the road against the Jets. Buffalo 35-NY Jets-20
I'm just curious how much Holmgren is going to play Alexander, and if he will get the record - TDs and yards.

Since the Chicago Bears got the job done in Green Bay last week, winning the division and a first round bye, the final regular season game against Minnesota is meaningless.
 
 I suspect the game plan will be to get out of Minneapolis without any injuries. I hope they only play Grossman at QB for a quarter. His history for the past two years has been to play three games, then sustain a major injury. This week will be his third game back. emoticon_wow

True to form, Buffalo lost to the propellersemoticon_cry emoticon_cry emoticon_cry emoticon_cry . I hope that Ralphie will get the idea and sack Donahoe and Mularkey. Because, quite frankly, five years worth of playoff drought is enough for me and the rest of bills fandom.

post_info.post_title: Ding Dong the Witch is Dead!!!!

Word from One Bills Drive is that:
 1) Donahoe's out (finally)
 
 2) Mularkey's staying put
 
 3) Ralph Wilson is regaining his role as president
 
 4) Marv Levy is returning to the Bills as GM
 
 
 Whaddyathink?emoticon_confused

Marv was a great coach. He had the Bills in the playoffs nearly every year and took them to several Super Bowls.
 
 That said, he's gotta be pushin' 80 years old or better now and has been out of football (as far as I know) for quite some time. Is making him GM a wise move? Can he still evaluate talent and relate to the players today?

I don't think age has anything to do with it. Marv is certainly still sharp and I believe he can adapt very quickly. One thing he mentioned is that he will build a team with players of strong character, which I believe is very important.
Mike Mularkey resigned as head coach of the Buffalo Bills Wednesday, so it looks like a total houscleaning is underway.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  NFL Picks Week 17
